page.title: 02GOWY VALLEY LANDSCAPE
page.content: Great Barrow, a village with many buildings of interest (see local history) has 50% of property built since the war. The planting of{TREES } by individuals & retention of native trees make this a very pleasant spot. From the sandstone ridge on which it is built it looks down on the wide river valley of the Gowy which flows north to the Mersey. The{ROMAN ROAD (A51) runs west to Chester. The old part of Guilden Sutton lies hidden in a small valley with the new rising to the west.Central is the ancient hamlet of Stamford Bridge,where the River Gowy is crossed. At the western end of the A51 lies Littleton developed first in Edwardian times it has been grad_ ually enlarged and now straddles the road.There are many old houses mainly {FARMS.}Many redundant farm buildings have been converted to houses.
